solution_line_template: Austin works a total of {hours_monday} + {hours_wednesday} + {hours_friday} = <<{hours_monday}+{hours_wednesday}+{hours_friday}={total_hours_per_week}>>{total_hours_per_week} hours a week.
Since he is paid ${pay_per_hour} per hour of work, he'll earn ${pay_per_hour}*{total_hours_per_week} = <<{pay_per_hour}*{total_hours_per_week}={earnings_per_week}>>{earnings_per_week} in a week.
To make ${bicycle_cost}, he'll have to work for ${bicycle_cost}/${earnings_per_week} = <<{bicycle_cost}/{earnings_per_week}={weeks_to_work}>>{weeks_to_work} weeks
